Actually the Bearcat Single and the Tri-Nozzle have already been fixed in the hotfix download 'patch' from around August 1st, though the main download hasn't been updated.

I looked back through this thread from late July through mid-August and didn't see anything about a hotfix. Was this patch ever released?

Hrm it was called NP2_02hotfixes8-1-13.zip

[Edit] At media fire
Thank you very kindly for answering my question and providing the link for the patch!

Hi, just posting to subscribe and to say thank you for your 300kn NERVA. Nothing else quite fits larger long range craft.

spelling
Heh, I love that engine but I sure wish it was a bit shorter

I see.

btw, love the 2.5m orbital bertha on my new lander.

Lol, that's all the big3 as I call them - NovaPunch, KW and AIES. AIES isn't as big as the other in terms of popularity, but it is the third-biggest rocket parts mod AFAIK.

It's quite funny:

AIES: PROOOOOOOOOBES! LAAAAANDEEEERS!!!!

KW: EEEENGIIIIIINES! TAAAANKS!!!!!

NovaPunch: HUUUUUUUUGE ROOCKEEEEEEEEETS!!!! LANDEEEEEERS! TAAAAANKS!!!

Oh yeah, I forgot FASA - but I think that it is disqualified from this list due to being a "historic" (or, in case of the latest updates, alternate historic) addon.

I'm trying to build the Thor Lander and the Odin one.

I found the parts for them are all scattered over the different cathegories. Is there a tutorial or post where it's explained how to assemble them, and what are they used for etc?

Both of their core part sets should be in the science tab (minus the capsules which are of course in the pods tab) Other things like RCS blocks or solar panels are in the usual stock places.

The only example on building them is the included craft files I guess.

In KSP 0.22 they'll both be pre-made assemblies you can load (assuming the feature makes it in of course)

Tiberion, a request regarding them going forward--since at the moment MCE calculates costs based on part categories, they'll be ridiculously expensive if they stay in the science tab. Would you consider putting them in their usual tabs?

I don't know what MCE is.

It's going to be pretty hard to find those parts if they're all spread out/ I can probably group them together in in another tab until they finally add sub-tabs or something.

Mission Controller Extended.

The mod that auto-generates costs for parts, among other things.

The code I wrote, because so many parts don't actually have distinct modules and even if so, I don't want to have to hardcode support for every mod ever, estimates a part's cost based, in part, on what tab it's in. Science parts get obscenely high costs because, well, they should (compared to girders and struts). But the Comm Dish, for instance, has no module to detect to say "I'm expensive" compared to a cubic octagonal strut...hence why I went with cost based on part categories as a good hack.

Nah I just saw the mechjeb case hanging off the side of his lander and was suggesting he add it to the cfg file off topic sorry

I hate not being able to provide a lot of details, but it's because I'm running a bunch of mods. I believe that NovaPunch is causing my game to crash. My game is modded-stable without it installed, but once it's installed, without fail, within 10 minutes of starting KSP, it crashes. Again, sorry that I can't be more helpful than "UR MODD MAEK MEE KRASHH", but like I said, I have other mods, so I can't rule out inter-mod shenanigans. Love it otherwise!

I hate not being able to provide a lot of details, but it's because I'm running a bunch of mods. I believe that NovaPunch is causing my game to crash. My game is modded-stable without it installed, but once it's installed, without fail, within 10 minutes of starting KSP, it crashes. Again, sorry that I can't be more helpful than "UR MODD MAEK MEE KRASHH", but like I said, I have other mods, so I can't rule out inter-mod shenanigans. Love it otherwise!

You're right that it may be 'inter-mod shenanigans' (lol, excellent phraseology!), but I had the same problem when I first installed NP as well. I solved it by going through NovaPunch as well as all my other parts and deleting stuff that I was never going to use. Like the NP command pods - for whatever reason I just didn't like the style of them, so I deleted the parts from the directory. And since I deleted those parts, that meant that the craft files that used them were broken, so I deleted those, and so on. You can give it a try anyway, see if it helps. If you've already done this, I'm out of ideas. Rotsa ruck!

You know, due to most NovaPunch textures being .tga or .png files, you can easily resize them with f.e. paint.NET or GIMP (I'm not sure about GIMP, though). Most of the NovaPunch textures are already at a senzible size, but some are not and can be resized to reduce memory required. Also, you can do this to all mods except for those that use .mbm files - I have resized most KW textures to 256*256, which is one sixteenth of the size of a 1024*1024 file, which KW uses as standard.

You know, due to most NovaPunch textures being .tga or .png files, you can easily resize them with f.e. paint.NET or GIMP (I'm not sure about GIMP, though). Most of the NovaPunch textures are already at a senzible size, but some are not and can be resized to reduce memory required. Also, you can do this to all mods except for those that use .mbm files - I have resized most KW textures to 256*256, which is one sixteenth of the size of a 1024*1024 file, which KW uses as standard.

So what you are saying is that it is an issue with KSP running out of memory?
Afraid so.

So what you are saying is that it is an issue with KSP running out of memory?

Aye. The more mods/parts you have, the more memory you use. If you can reduce memory per part, you can increase the amount of parts. The only way to reduce memory/part is, as far as I know, to downsize textures. I usually set diffuse maps (the normal textures) to 256*256 and normal maps (the ones that tell the game where to make it look like there is an indent or bump) to 5112*512. Emmissives also go to 256*256. I never upsize textures, though, that will retain the bad quality and just make it use more memory.

Darn. Is loading from the VAB heavily memory intensive? It seems that after I have been messing with a rocket for a little bit, and then try to launch it, as soon as it leaves the VAB, even before it gets to the pad, it crashes.

All scene transitions cause memory spikes. The only way to fix your problems is to remove parts that you don't need and/or resize textures. Also, the longer time you play KSP, the more the memory usage increases. This means that if your memory usage is just below the limit when starting the game, it will most likely crash from memory overflow after a few hours of gaming, making a restart necessary. Currently, I'm quite close to the limit, but I only experience crashes very rarely.
